alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 10:08PM EDT until April 18 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Menominee River near Niagara affecting Florence, Dickinson, Marinette and Menominee Counties. Menominee River near Florence affecting Florence, Dickinson and Iron Counties. Pine River near Florence affecting Florence County. Pike River near Amberg affecting Marinette County. Menominee River below Twin Falls Dam-Iron Mountain affecting Florence, Dickinson, Marinette and Menominee Counties. Brule River near Commonwealth affecting Florence, Dickinson, Iron and Forest Counties. Menominee River near Vulcan affecting Marinette, Dickinson and Menominee Counties. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. For the Menominee River...including Twin Falls Dam-Iron Mountain, Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, McAllister...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near Florence. * WHEN...Until Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Floodwaters reach a few homes and cottages along Runbers Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Friday was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Tuesday morning and continue falling to 8.0 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.9 feet on 06/15/1981. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon.
